text: Apple CEO Tim Cook announced the new iPhone 15 at their headquarters in Cupertino on September 12.
Elon Musk's Tesla delivered record numbers of Model Y vehicles in Shanghai last quarter.
Microsoft founder Bill Gates visited the World Health Organization in Geneva yesterday.
Dr. Sarah Chen from Stanford University published groundbreaking research on Monday.
Amazon Web Services opened a new data center in Mumbai, India in March 2024.
The Beatles performed their last concert at Apple Corps headquarters in London.
NASA astronaut Neil Armstrong landed on the Moon on July 20, 1969.
Sundar Pichai announced Google's new Pixel 8 phone at the Made by Google event.
Professor James Wilson from MIT will speak at the conference in Boston next week.
Netflix CEO Reed Hastings stepped down from his position in January 2023.
The United Nations headquarters in New York hosted the climate summit.
Mark Zuckerberg renamed Facebook to Meta in October 2021.
Toyota announced the new Camry model will be manufactured in Kentucky.
Dr. Anthony Fauci addressed the National Institutes of Health in Washington D.C.
Samsung released the Galaxy S24 series at their Unpacked event in San Jose.
Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway held its annual meeting in Omaha on Saturday.
OpenAI released ChatGPT in November 2022, changing the AI landscape.
Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the new parliament building in Delhi.
Spotify founder Daniel Ek announced layoffs at their Stockholm office.
The European Central Bank raised interest rates in Frankfurt last Thursday.
Patient John Smith, age 45, was prescribed Metformin 500mg twice daily.
Dr. Emily Watson at Mayo Clinic diagnosed the condition on February 15.
The FDA approved Pfizer's new vaccine for distribution in the United States.
Memorial Hospital in Chicago reported increased cases of influenza this winter.
Nurse practitioner Maria Garcia administered the Moderna booster shot.
